newsitem.title: FRANCE: Alcatel CIT job cut report "exaggerated" - Alcatel.
newsitem.headline: Alcatel CIT job cut report "exaggerated" - Alcatel.

text.p: A spokesman for Alcatel Alsthom said on Thursday figures in a newspaper report, which said its telecom equipment subsidiary Alcatel CIT planned to shed 1,400 jobs, seemed too high.
"We're not confirming the figure. This figure of 1,400 lay-offs seems to us exaggerated," the spokesman said. He added that transfers within the company had been envisaged.
French afternoon daily Le Monde said on Thursday Alcatel CIT planned to hold a works council meeting on April 2 to present a plan to shed 1,400 of its 9,400 employees.

Last October Alactel CIT said it expected to shed 1,600 jobs over time in a reorganisation to cut costs ahead of telecommunications deregulation. It said the company faced two difficult years, mainly because of a decline in equipment orders from its main client France Telecom.
